title: More efficient processing of disk sorting with border values for row data
OB: When sorting data on disk with 40000 rows using a program that processes less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed by DtE: 1) Save the file as a temporary file. 2) Load the file into memory. 3) Sort the data. 4) Save the sorted data back to a temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1) Sort 40000 rows of data on disk. 2) Configure the program to process less than 40000 rows. Observe the operations performed by DtE: 1) Save the file as a temporary file. 2) Load the file into memory. 3) Sort the data. 4) Save the sorted data back to a temporary file.
